website_summaries.verdict: Versatile with enough stitches to experiment later on, this machine is a solid choice that won't break the bank.
pros: Easy top drop-in bobbin and automatic needle threader let you start out of the box
One-step buttonhole feature is easy to use
Lots of stitch options for a beginner's model
cons: Sensitive foot pedal takes some getting used to

website_summaries.verdict: While perfect for beginners, this inexpensive machine might not offer enough to tempt experienced sewists.
pros: Offers exceptional value for money if you want a beginner machine
Features 27 built-in stitches with 63 stitch functions
Simple dial controls make changing stitches easy
Portable for moving to different locations
cons: Not versatile enough for experienced users or complex projects

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine! I took a very basic sewing class about 10 years ago and I was intimidated to try again but this machine is so easy to use. Love the needle threader, the extra feet and automatic bobbin drop in feature. The stitching is nice and even. All over it is a great machine for beginners. Only thing is it’s not great for super thick Fabrics like jeans etc
customer_reviews.author: Andrea W.

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps the worst sewing machine I've ever used in my over thirty ...
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps the worst sewing machine I've ever used in my over thirty years of sewing.Tension problems from day one.The LED light is sooooo dim.The plastic bobbin cover is poorly designed and a hassle to pull out. So much of the design of this machine is awkward. Even upper threading is a pain. The take up lever is buried so deep in the "nose" of the machine that catching it as part of the process is difficult. Unfortunately I let my return window lapse hoping against hope that the machine might prove to be of some worth. But no such luck. I can't recommend this machine at all.
customer_reviews.author: kent streed

customer_reviews.title: Took it out of box. Set it up. ...
customer_reviews.text: Took it out of box. Set it up. Started to see and stitch started skipping. Tried troubleshooting as per instructions. Then called manufacturer. Was told to take for service!
customer_reviews.author: vicky

customer_reviews.title: Oh Brother!
customer_reviews.text: I used to sew as a kid but I was never that great. I had a dinky little machine that would always jam up and I was certain it was because I'm an idiot. Guess what, I'm not an idiot. I just had a crappy sewing machine. This machine is decidedly not crappy. The only time it has jammed was due to a little light user error (ok, maybe I am an idiot). This sewing machine has also done wonders for my social life. I make cool stuff for my friends and family and that makes me undeniably more tolerable to be around.
customer_reviews.author: the Olivers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine at this price range.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1 Built-in easy needle threader 2 Top drop-in bobbin 3 Includes instructional DVD 4 Comes with 6 sewing feet 5 LED light at work area 6. Price ( I paid USD 99) Cons: Does not come with case or cover. Final thoughts: I wanted to buy a good quality, simple to use and an affordable sewing machine, Brother XM2701 fits the bill. Brother has included a DVD which helped me setup the machine in less than 30 minutes. So far I have no problem with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Moon

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with this machine!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it a couple times since Oct. 2018, simple sewing, nothing fancy. The bobbin holder came loose so lower tension thread started tangling. I tried to fix it by taking the plate off, not sure if its as secure as it should be, but now I can't get the screws to screw back down to secure the plate. I had to walk away I was so frustrated!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Destiny

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Purchased during Prime Day as a Christmas present. Glad I gave it to my daughter early to take sewing classes because even the sewing place could not get the lower bobbin to catch. Had to practically beg Amazon to take it back since I purchased during Prime Day and there is a VERY short window to return things. I only got a partial refund. Not a good machine. Ended up purchasing a Singer from somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Terri J Abdis

customer_reviews.title: Sew easy
customer_reviews.text: I tried sewing once before and couldn't get the tension right for the bobbin and gave up. Gave away the sewing machine I bought on Black Friday 2010. Seven and a half years later, I decided fabric gift bags are too expensive to buy so MUST learn to make them. How hard can it be? Not hard at all with this machine. The automatic bobbin and the way the treading works is SO EASY. I just watched the video on youtube and made four gift bags the first day.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: Works good for a beginner like me. Just a old guy trying to hem some pants and fix some hole in favorites shirts. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Ketola

customer_reviews.title: It is so great!
customer_reviews.text: The machine is extremely good for family use, easy to operate, good for all level. It can even sew thick leather, unbelievable. The first machine is very disappointing, it skips stitch, tension is a forever problem, I asked a replacement, this one is very good. So I think this brand and model is good, just some machines happen to be problem occasionally. Overall, it is good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It must have been a defect
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use but did not work from the minute i got it out of the box.... sad because the previous brother i purchased was great.... i changed and figited with every setting on tension .. changed bobbins and thread and could not get it to work correctly.... tech support no help... i had tried what they advised.... finally sent it bak
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't forget to order thread
customer_reviews.text: It's about average for sewing machine, definitely not for kids... I have used sewing machines before so it's just a matter of figuring out this particular one. Wasn't that hard for me but for someone who has never use a sewing machine before it can be quite overwhelming. Plus I have some issues with the back button.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Occasional Sewer!
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine! I needed an upgrade from my old clunker. This one certainly has some nice bells and whistles. I love the bobbin loading from the top. I wasn't able to figure out how to use the threader, but I can easily put the thread through the needle still. The machine runs smoothly and is MUCH quieter than my original machine. This isn't a fancy sewing machine by any means, but has plenty of options for the sewing hobbyist. I even loved that it's Prime so I was able to get it quickly!
customer_reviews.author: SnowAeris

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material
customer_reviews.text: I had this machine less than a year and I had problems starting from the first few months. Even though it looks solid, some important pieces like the hook and bobbin case are cheap plastic. Mine got broken easily and the machine started skipping stitches. It says it's under warranty for a year. Unfortunately, I took it to the service a few days late and asked for $99 service charge. Even if I had it fixed, it was very likely to get broken in a few months again. I would not suggest this machine to anyone, especially beginners. It is difficult to keep up with its problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Machine doesn't sew properly out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The tension on this machine never worked out of the box, after trying all the tension levels, it still would not work correctly, very disappointed. This is my first Brother machine, I purchased this for my granddaughter as a starter machine, it will be my last Brother.
customer_reviews.author: SWorth

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a simple machine to use for mending and stitching on my crafts so I read that is machine has three basic stitches; straight, stretch, and satin. Did not realize until I got it that yes, it has those three stitch types but multiples of stitches in each category. What a nice surprise, especially for the money. It sews well, and it easy to use. The instructions for winding the bobbin and threading the machine are right on the machine. I also like the bobbin threading feature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only need to sew a straight seam but.....
customer_reviews.text: I have an older model Brother sewing machine and it's amazing how things have progressed. There are cool, fancy stretch stitches, buttonholes and other features that I will never use. For me, it's the basics of this machine that make it a winner. It is very clear how to load, thread and insert the bobbin and it's also easy to see how to thread the machine before you start sewing. This one even has an attached gizmo that helps you thread the needle. I messed that up regularly on the older machine. I will probably use only about 10% of this machine's features. I think it is likely to be a great option for most people.
customer_reviews.author: bluffingwildly

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this product❤️❤️👐🏾 So easy to use for beginners. I was able to navigate the Instructions so easily with the video and finally made my very own high low shirt which I customized with acrylic paints. A new piece to add to me wearable art line.
customer_reviews.author: Queen of Arts

customer_reviews.title: Great sewing machine!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sewing machine!!!! It works great and threading is really easy to do. I had no trouble setting it up and it was really quick to do. I really recommend it to beginners because the directions are very clear and the sewing line is very straight. It’s quite light weight for this sewing machine which I’m very impressed by. Overall great sewing machine
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Brother
customer_reviews.text: More complicated to use than expected. Ever getting a straight stitch was a hassle. Poor instructions
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Good machine
customer_reviews.text: Purchased my Brother Lightweight for my Granddaughter (first machine). I was able to help her get started and soon she was doing all of it by herself. Every machine has its own "personality" and I was able to adapt quickly to this machine when helping her.. Love the grip for easy pick up and the tension was perfect on first stitches...no adjustment needed. Have two more Granddaughters with birthdays later this year and I plan on getting this Brother Lightweight for them also!!
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Price gouging during a pandemic
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on March 20 for $87 and now it's selling for $224. It's criminal that anyone should ask such a high price when people are using it to sew masks during a pandemic. Apart from price, it's an acceptable sewing machine. Since it's lightweight, it has trouble sewing through 4+ layers of fabric, and I haven't even tried denim. I can't even get it to sew through the 3 layers of mask+ elastic on my masks. Overall, somewhat underwhelmed and wish I had shelled out more for a more powerful machine. It is easy to set up and use, and is relatively full-featured (automatic needle threading, side thread cutter, bobbin winding, reverse stitching, button hole stitch).
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lee

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is the most frustrating sewing machine I’ve ever used! I’ve had it for a few months now and every time I try to sew something it sucks the fabric in and I have to yank it out resulting in tearing my fabric. It’s done it to all kinds of fabric and with different needles! So either I got a defective one or this brand just flat out stinks. I never had this problem on my singer.
customer_reviews.author: SBeas12

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine! I'm am brand new to sewing and ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent machine! I'm am brand new to sewing and had no problem using this machine. It is very easy to use and seems like a good quality and sturdy. It is very easy to navigate. I watched a couple of basic youtube videos on how o use a sewing machine and was making blankets and burp clothes for my baby in no time. Awesome price (I got it for about $80). It's worth every penny and has already paid for itself with everything I have been able to make in the last month. I'm having so much fun with it and I'm very glad I chose this model. I believe it will meet my needs for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: My grandmother would be proud!
customer_reviews.text: I am 52 years old and just bought my first machine! The XM2701 is perfect for beginners! I have only had it a few weeks and have already made multiple throw pillows with zippers and buttons, placed darts in pants, and hemmed pants! The instruction manual was my go to at first to master inserting using/inserting the bobbin, sewing button holes, the zipper, etc., but online tutorials make it even easier! Make sure you try out off the accessories and don't be afraid to mess things up at first! I would also suggest buying a storage case (I found one for under $25 at Walmart) unless you have a permanent table for it! I have a NEW HOBBY NOW~
customer_reviews.author: Regina Spach

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter that is just beginning to learn to sew. This machine is totally a piece of junk and it is way over priced. The thread from the top bobbin kept tangling in the bottom bobbin and then the machine jambs and and stops working. You have to continue to unjam and re-thread the machine. You can't even sew 5 stitches and it stops working. Very frustrating and waste of money. Sent back no just waiting on my refund from the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter10

customer_reviews.title: Really like the needle threader and top mount bobbin!
customer_reviews.text: Just needed a basic model, but this had a needle threader and top-mount bobbin (which I'd never had before) so that sealed the deal. Once I got the hang of the needle threader (just read the directions!!) I was hooked. Also really like the top drop in bobbin placement--no need to dismantle the front and awkwardly place the bobbin and pull up & keep hold of the bottom thread, etc. Simple instructions to get one going right away. Will likely not use most of the fancy stitches, but am very happy to move on from my old machine. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Julie in Santa Ana

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine.
customer_reviews.text: This is light enough I can put it up when I need it and take down and store. I have been sewing for years and wanted just a simple machine to do simple things. I am not a designer or sew complicated things. I want to make curtains for my laundry room and coats for my little dogs for winter since they are reluctant to go outside if it is cool out. Everything I have found for them look like they are about to go out in the Artic circle and not just cool times in Texas. They do not wear clothes usually because they are, well, dogs! Anyway this is a good machine for what little I do.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: It's so easy to learn!!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think I would be able to learn so quickly!!! Day 2 and I've made 16 masks already!! If I can do it anyone can. I have always wanted to learn and with so much time on my hands I need something to do!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bargain beginner machine
customer_reviews.text: Great little beginner sewing machine. I like the slick little needle eye threader, that was a very welcome surprise! No fussing with trying to feed the thread through the eye of the needle. Spooling a bobbin was really easy, too. I'm a beginner at all this and so far it has been a pleasure to sew with. I've tried sewing before with older machines that relatives let me use and I didn't really enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Branson

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your $$
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this machine to make face masks out of thin cotton fabric. The machine can't handle any type of thickness, and cannot handle pleats, even out of the thin cotton material. I've had to order a second different better sewing machine now that can handle more, spending more money and now having to wait a longer time frame to get the new one.
customer_reviews.author: Catalina 67

customer_reviews.title: Out with old in with new
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine for my wife to replace her 50 year old dinosaur machine that was all metal and weighed a ton. It came well packed with excellent instructions. It has all the best features and is really lightweight for portability. We ordered a separate soft carry bag for it. It probably will not last 50 years like her old one since it is all plastic but it seems very durable considering. Overall it is a great sewing machine. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Didn't know I needed it!
customer_reviews.text: Great sewing machine for me! I haven't used a sewing machine in decades, wow am I that old? Nope not really, it's just not something I really needed, until I got one! I've fixed a ton of stuff that would have probably have seen the trash if i hadn't. It's paid for itself in repairs already. I highly reccomend reading the instructions that come with it and familiarize yourself with the stitches, there are so many that come with this really and truly that unless you're doing some intricate work it's all you'll need. I've fixed sweaters, pillows and cases, laundry hampers a comforter and more. I bought the machine with 27 built in stitches and I'm happy I did!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to learn to thread it.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like the fact that I had to watch the video repeatedly to learn to thread it and will have to likely do it again if I don't use it for a little while. Ease of threading is essential. If you are just beginning, i encourage you to go to a store and have someone show you how the machine threads before you purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OMG AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: Let's face it as you get older, the eye sight starts to go. I knew I wanted a new sewing machine, but I needed certain features that would make it easier to use. One of the best feature this has is an auto threader. It makes it so much easier than taking an extra 15 minutes trying to thread that tiny little needle. I love the fact that it also has a clear cover for the bobbin instead of realizing half way through your project that the bobbin ran out. Great product..great price and incredibly easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kwage

customer_reviews.title: My first sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: This is my first sewing machine and I like it very much. I find it easy to operate with the help of the videos, and it's a great help that there are directions printed all over the machine itself. There are several full sets of instructions for the basic operations of the machine - a huge help to a novice such as myself. Everything about this machine has just been so easy to use, and I'm learning a great deal along the way. The device for threading the needle is also a most welcome convenience. I'm mostly using this machine for fixing and fitting my clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: GREAT MACHINE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this machine so that my 8 year old daughter and I could learn to sew together. PROS: easy to use, lots of functionality, quiet. CONS: the self threader is hard to use (I end up giving up and threading the needle myself), the foot peddle slides (which is easily remedied with 2 sided tape) . The instructions state to only use the bobbins that come with the machine. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Machine that's up for a challenge
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to use! To give it 5 stars, it would have to be the most amazing machine I've ever seen. This one can be portable as well as stationary. I gave this things a challenge and it didn't tear my project- the machine jammed when I was working on a thick seam with slick stretchy fabric (I was sewing straps on a bathing suit) and I was able to take apart the bottom to remove the tangled up mass of thread. It was an awkward stitch that probably should have been sewn by hand, so I was pushing the limit of the machine. I loved that it was so easy to take apart and put back together.
customer_reviews.author: Larissa Popp

customer_reviews.title: Not at all Easy
customer_reviews.text: I use to make my own and my sons clothes years ago. I have always used a Singer sewing machine. My machine was old and I bought this to replace it. The directions are hard to follow and because of the situation right now I can’t get ahold of anyone to help me. I have put the machine away and by the time I can get ahold of someone they will probably tell me I have to pay for instructions. Extremely unhappy but I guess I am stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but not great
customer_reviews.text: This was my first machine, and it works pretty good. The only thing that makes it not great is the button hole device. It is terrible. There is only one stop on it, therefore it will make only one pass to make a hole. Therefore you are left with button holes with only one stitch around it. If you keep going, the machine just continues to straight stitch down your project ruining it. Other machines I've seen are equipped with button hole devices with 2 feet so that you can make as many revolutions as you want to make a strong button hole.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Me

customer_reviews.title: New to sewing
customer_reviews.text: I am completely new to sewing. As in I’ve never used a sewing machine in my life. If you look up instructions for this model number on YT there will be a video that’s more helpful to watch than the instructions. I love this machine so much. I love the quick bobbin feature and the little thing near the needle that sticks your thread through the hole for you. I own a clothing business and I use it to change tags from the supplier. It works perfect for this and all other things. It may confuse you in the beginning but it’s 10/10 worth buying
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: Wow! great sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: I am a senior vet & very new to sewing. Instructions very good & set up easier than i imagined. The auto bobbin & needle threader worked well for these old eyes! I was sewing in no time, nothing fancy but straight stitching two pieces together with no gathering of the thread. I notice this value priced machine can lots of fancy stuff but basic sewing for me is great, Good buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Waist money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from 9/24/2019, but now it was broken, i brought the machine to the store to fix it but the guy told me shouldn’t buy this brand anymore, Couldn’t fix, very weird. This was a second machine of this brand i had. I don’t recommend this brand. Waist money.
customer_reviews.author: QHogan

customer_reviews.title: Threading the needle is awful, but after that you're set!
customer_reviews.text: I grew up learning to use a sewing machine that would automatically thread the needle when you pulled the thread a certain way. This was not the case. You actually have to follow the directions... However, once you can do that this is a super easy to use machine. My household uses this machine mainly for quick fixes for dog toys or garment alterations or fixes. I haven't done any major projects yet but I don't think they will be an issue with this machine. If you can show your child how to thread the needle I think this will also be a great option for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Yasmin S.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a sewing machine before, and this one was easy to set up and use. I've made 3 blankets, lanyards, and baby shower gifts. So happy I got this machine!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Clifton

customer_reviews.title: I am ecstatic!
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I've moved from an easy-bake oven to the kitchen at Chez Panisse. From whiffleball to professional baseball. It's AMAZING. Years of sewing on "okay" sewing machines were like practicing to paint the Mona Lisa with chewed-on first-grade classroom paintbrushes. Learning techniques with mediocre tools. Honing my craft by working around the inadequacies of the tools at hand. I'm ready now. To sew. ALL. THE. THINGS. I tried out this machine. And I'm suddenly a bit in love! I have a feeling we are going to make many amazing things together.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa Thornberry

customer_reviews.title: Great machine!
customer_reviews.text: This sewing machine is very light but still has many features. It sews beautifully! I am used to heavy, older sewing machines, and this one is fun! But I had to learn the hard way that is a bit finicky if you don't follow the directions! I was used to swapping out any bobbins I had on hand. Even though the old metal ones are the same size, using them cause this machine to bind up somewhere. But it is inexpensive to buy inexpensive replacements (be sure to order the correct part number). Also, the threading guides are very specific. It's not at all difficult and the machine hums.
customer_reviews.author: janzine

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners, easy to set up and use!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter who needed a machine to make minor repairs. She loves it. It was easy to setup and learn and she loves the threading guide which is printed on the machine! Two issues: 1) The lever to raise the presser foot is in an odd place, and 2) she is left-handed and of course, the machine’s controls are right-hand oriented. Other than that - this is a great machine for what she uses it for - making repairs and doing minor sewing projects.
customer_reviews.author: Reine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginner
customer_reviews.text: Great product . I have NEVER used a sewing machine so I was very hesitant and scared but with the cd it’s a no brained . I actually didn’t use the cd but I found the video that is same as cd on YouTube . My biggest fear was figuring out how to thread it . Extremely easy !! I do definitely recommend this for a beginner ! Stitching is beautiful ! Extremely simple to back stitch as well .
customer_reviews.author: Constance Carlsen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use !!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product and very easy to learn and use ! It came with an instructional DVD and handbook. I've never had a sewing machine this one is my first and it only took me 30min to learn to use all the features. I made 2 masks and for my first try it was really easy! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginners Machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a gift for my mom and she really liked it. I am happy that she said it's very easy for her to use. 100% recommended for beginners as my mom was totally beginner
customer_reviews.author: Rehan Asghar

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this
customer_reviews.text: I had a little sewing machine (that I paid about $20 for) for years and it worked fine, but was cheaply made and when the bobbin thread got tangled and I pulled kinda hard on it, something must've broke because the thread got super tangled when I tried to sew anything after that. I had been thinking about getting a new sewing machine for a while and figured now was the time. I'm SO happy with this sewing machine. It's definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa S

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I spent weeks doing research on sewing machines for beginners and I'm happy I chose this one. The quick bobbin feature is amazing and really kept me from getting frustrated when starting out. I do wish the light over the needle was a little bit brighter. The instruction book that came with it is kind of confusing as far as what settings are best for each stitch but overall this is an awesome machine. On a side note, not everyone who sews likes flowers. I wish there weren't flowers on the machine...
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sewing Machine
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is an excellent sewing machine. It is straightforward to learn and operate. I greatly appreciate the auto needle threader due to my poor eyesight. With its many features and 27 stitches, it is well suited for beginners to experienced sewists. It is a joy to use. I had done several pants, skirts, curtains, and other DIYs.
customer_reviews.author: Kim N

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth machine!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is such an upgrade on the mini Sunbeam I was using that broke in 5 uses. This brother machine comes with a very easy to follow DVD guide. I am giving 4 stars because I read on some reviews that the machine skips stitches. I was stitching with the zigzag stitch and it skipped for whatever reason. I am not sure if it was the thread tension or something else. And that it only came with 4 bobbins. Other than it is an awesome machine so far. I have sewn only shirts. I do not know how it sews with tougher fabrics. Machine comes with several accessories!
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginner sewers
customer_reviews.text: Like many others who are buying this, I picked it up to sew masks for doctors and nurses through the novel coronavirus pandemic. I've used a sewing machine before many years ago, but this was incredibly easy to set up. Threading is very, very easy and the instruction book is thorough and very helpful. I did have some initial issues with thread tension, but was able to fix it quickly. I'm absolutely thrilled with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kae Winters

customer_reviews.title: PEDAL SUCKS
customer_reviews.text: just started sewing and this is not a good one to start with. The main reason being that the FOOT PEDAL IS WAY TOO FAST at the slightest press. I even taped something to it to keep it from pressing all the way!! NOPE. Also "jam free" is bs, mine kept jamming for no reason (with same fabric I used in sewing class so I know its not that) and after one use the thread from the bottom wont come up anymore. Also it doesnt come with something to block the top thread in place, it flied off a few times.. Not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Vera G.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: This little guy works like a champ, and has so many features. I've worked with older singers in the past and going from those to this was like a flip phone to a smart phone. It's very easy to use, and there's tons of great videos online to help you get started.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Great little buy!
customer_reviews.text: After three sewing classes this little gem works like a pro! Never used a sewing machine before, and this is very easy to use and has the options I need. Was very surprised to see guys like me in these sewing classes because they too, are tired of paying outrageous fees for hemming pants etc. Sure wish that I had one on these babies when I was a single Dad with three kids. Now I can hem and stitch for my grand-kids which is GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: John-Michael

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good machine for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine as a stand in while my fancy machine is being serviced. I do fairly advanced sewing and am frankly surprised at this machines performance at such a low price point. Recommended as a good machine for a beginner or anyone who does light sewing and crafting, or like me as a standby. I wouldn’t attempt any heirloom sewing or heavy quilting on this machine. It is also light weight and very portable.
customer_reviews.author: eileen d. lowell

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner Machine
customer_reviews.text: This is my first sewing machine ever and after looking high and low, reading all the reviews on all the different sewing machines out there for beginners this is the one I decided to go with. It was very intuitive to figure out but also came with a handy DVD and instruction booklet for anything I had questions about. The sewing machine itself is nice and lightweight and has everything you would need for basic sewing even a few perks like decorative stitches, buttonhole and reverse. At a price point of $75 dollars it couldnt be beat and definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Yoli Naz

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Perfect for beginners or hobbiests!
customer_reviews.text: Finally got around to using my sewing machine more than once every year. It's held up well to making burp cloths to hemming denim to fixing buttons. It's important to note that seeing machines have a strep learning curve. Be sure to read the included manual and watch some YouTube videos if you aren't sure where to begin or what to do. The instructional CD that comes with the machine is dinosaur age old but it gets the job mostly done. Pleased with my purchase overall and recommend this to anyone looking to do more than fix clothes. I'm looking into making my own skirt next!
customer_reviews.author: Raine

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed a lightweight machine in a hurry to do some projects during isolation. I'm experienced with sewing machines having owned several over the last 50 yrs. Best feature is the self needle threader but overall it's well made and easy to figure out (I had it threaded before looking at the directions). It took about 3 hrs of messing around with the tension control and reloading a warped plastic bobbin to get it dialed in but since I've turned out about a hundred masks with no hiccups (except some of those plastic bobbins are worthless). I'm successfully using a good old metal Single bobbin now and it's more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: DocM

customer_reviews.title: Repackaged from Amazon Warehouse Deals:  Broken! Only sews in reverse.
customer_reviews.text: Bought repackaged through Amazon Warehouse Deals for my wife. The description said only the box was damaged and so it had been repackaged. It came in and looked fine, but is broken. The DVD inside was also smashed. The machine will only sew in reverse, with one size stitch. We tried the different setting, re-threading, etc. with no success. Called Brother and they said we should return or could get it serviced for free under warranty. Will be returning as it is a brand NEW machine! It seems like a great model though, we will be purchasing this same one from Brother and skipping the deals!
customer_reviews.author: Luke Garner

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to learn and use, plus there’s lots of videos from the company to help learn and troubleshoot. I had never seen before and started sewing right when I got the machine, now a couple months later I’m the go to seamstress in my neighborhood. I love this machine, I had tried one once before that I just couldn’t figure out, but this one is easy and awesome. My only issue was using it with Stretchy jersey Lycra fabric it can get tangled in it so I wouldn’t use that in the beginning but if you do you can just use a seam ripper to get it out.
customer_reviews.author: Ok

customer_reviews.title: What I like about the machine isnit is easy to thread upper ...
customer_reviews.text: I am returning XM2701 and upgrading. Problems I see with this machine - foot pedal is flimsy - it moves away from you as you use it, and there is not a sew forward button (alternative to using a foot pedal). Also, the reverse button is an aweful design. You have to hold the botton down while sewing in reverse. Very cumbersome. What I like about the machine isnit is easy to thread upper and lower threads. It is lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Paula M. Hein

customer_reviews.title: Quality of machine
customer_reviews.text: Brother has always been a great manufacturer of sewing machines. I have always had a Brother sewing machine for over 20 yrs. So when I burned the motor making masks, I immediately purchased a new one. And I am glad I did. :)
customer_reviews.author: Barnell Neville

customer_reviews.title: Very beginner friendly
customer_reviews.text: This machine is very beginner friendly. I had never touch a sewing machine let alone knew anything about sewing before buying this, now only 2 months later I am fully making leggings and other items. My favorite feature is the needle threader. I used the twin needle and had to thread them myself and let me tell you, it took FOREVER. love this machine
customer_reviews.author: Shakira

customer_reviews.title: Great machine! Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: Great little machine. Great price! Love the front drop in bobbin, the only way to go! Fits my needs for general sewing. Ive hesitated to buy a Brother machine because the price is so low, I figured the quality would not be there but this little machine exceeded my expectations by far! I've sewn for 50 years but in the last few years found it tedious because of broken thread and bobbin problems. I was tired of chasing the under machine bobbin. If I were to do serious sewing, I would probably consider a computerized machine but I like the Brother brand.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Witt

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: I was able to use it very quickly. I now use it for quilting. It is easy and consistent in performance. I got a babylock but I still love and prefer it. It was fairly easy to figure out once I relearned how to fill the bobbins. I got it for a great price before it went up to over twice as much so look out for deals.
customer_reviews.author: kdwhite39

customer_reviews.title: Broke before I could complete my first project
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine to learn to sew back in April. It didn't have much time to use it so it stayed in the box until June. Three weeks into using it, it's stopped functioning properly. I took it to a service center and was told it's a timing issue which often happens with thick fabric. Well, I was using the machine with regular cotton fabric so there is no good reason why this would have happened. Wish I had spent the money to buy a better and more quality model because now it's basically a giant paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Uvagrad

customer_reviews.title: Um where's the xtra feet???
customer_reviews.text: Well I ordered this because it advertised additional feet for the machine. 6 total. I got one. I should have went with a used one off of the marketplace. I was looking for those extra feet and I got 1. Not real happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use until you go over a thick seam or even elastic
customer_reviews.text: This machine can not tolerate thick fabric or seams. I took everything apart include the bobbin housing but could not get it back into alignment. I returned it. It worked for about 30 minutes sewing time. I bought a reconditioned sears Kenmore metal sewing machine which is outstanding even though it is 50 or 60 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazon raised the price almost $70
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this machine for a beginner but what I dont like is how Amazon jacked the price up from $99 to now $165 in a week. I teach girls 10-16 to sew for free and that totally went out of my budget.
customer_reviews.author: mhawk5701

customer_reviews.title: Truly fine for beginner
customer_reviews.text: It’s real hard to find a long bolster in America. and so I figured I will have to make one myself, and I absolutely have zero knowledge for sewing. I took a lot of time to find a good machine for my very beginner skill. This is the perfect choice. All the instruction can be scary to look at first but keep follow it and everything works just fine. I have successfully made my own bolster, pillow covers, and a simle pillow dog bed!
customer_reviews.author: Bi Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Cosplay shenanigans!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used a sewing machine in years so I was very nervous to use this for the first time. The quick guide that came with it was extremely helpful and easy to follow. Even without the quick guide the machine has plenty of markings and reminders of how to wind a bobbin, how to load the bobbin, how to thread the machine. All of my nerves went away after making the first pass with this baby. I'm working on a cosplay and needed it for some sewing bits. Very very happy with my purchase and the price. I'll update if I run into any issues, but after a 3 hour sewing session I am over the moon!
customer_reviews.author: Afton Don Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine, and great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my son and he loved itr. He had never sewn on a machine before and wanted it for puppets he makes. So easy, he figured it out withing minutes with zero help from anyone. . Very good quality for the money. Really an excellent deal. Excellent first sewing machine. or even as a basic machine for household repairs, curtains etc....
customer_reviews.author: Advocate Mom

customer_reviews.title: 8 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a beginner machine for my 8yo daughter. She has been able to easily learn how to thread the machine and sew simple stitches. I used it to sew several quick projects and found it to be a nice machine. If you sew frequently, it may be too much of a beginner machine for you. But if you’re learning, or just want something for the occasional project, this is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: schris7

customer_reviews.title: I want my old machine back!
customer_reviews.text: as a senior, I HATE this machine. I read all the reviews before purchasing. The worst part is threading the needle. I've been sewing since I was in jr high school so this is NOT my first rodeo. On multiple occasions I have spent HOURS trying to use the automatic threader. I just plain can't see it! I give up & use a needle threader!! Maybe it's made for these young kids who give it great reviews & have "young eyes"!
customer_reviews.author: sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had a sears Kenmore sewing machine years ago, and looking at the Brother I thought it had a modern look and features to it when I received it as a Christmas gift. I was surprised at the ease of using it and the instructions were easy to follow. The threading of the machine in itself was much easier than machine's in the past, it pretty much threads itself. My first project was hemming up some new pants. Not having sewed in years, I was surprised how well they looked, store bought!! So I would highly recommend this machine, especially for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic beginner machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine about 8 moths ago and taught myself how to sew with it. I started making dog bandanas to donate to my local shelter and when the pandemic hit I switched to face masks. I have now made over 700 masks which by my best estimate is over 2000 hours of sewing time. And this machine has handled it beautifully. Literally the only thing I have to do is clean out the lint once a week. Never in my wildest dreams did I think this machine would hold up like it has. Super easy to learn on, more stitches than I need as a complete beginner, dependable, and relatively quiet. You can't go wrong with this one!
customer_reviews.author: MOLLY EMERY

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: My 1974 Viking machine stopped working and they couldn't find replacement parts so I ordered this Brother machine. I LOVE it! It is easy to use, I love that you don't have to thread the needle, it does it for you.... it's so simple to to turn the knob and quickly change stitches, it's super light, especially compared to my old machine. I think for the value and what you get, it is an excellent deal. Can you purchase a better machine, yes, but this is great for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: My very first sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: My mom and grandmother are both seamstresses, but I never picked that up from them. As an adult, I decided to purchase a sewing machine and learn. My mom helped guide me to pick this little machine out. I am impressed with how many different stitches it can do. It is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: TT Westmoreland

customer_reviews.title: If you can't sew, have never sewed - you can use this!
customer_reviews.text: Most important is watch the video to start using this machine. There is a dvd included in the package, but you can also find it on Youtube. Once you do this, using this is really quite easy. I was amazed at how fast I was able to start sewing and sewing well! I have only just begun to learn about this machine, which is actually nice, because as I become more adept, there are more options for me to try out. Overall, works very well.
customer_reviews.author: qisabella

customer_reviews.title: Great sewing machine.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first sewing machine and I’m glad I chose this one. It has so many great features! And what a great price too! I love the look and the ease of use. Comes with many extras to get you started and DVD instructional video to help those who are just starting or like me whom haven’t sewn in many years it’s a great reminder. It is a machine worth owning.
customer_reviews.author: WooGirl

customer_reviews.title: My granddaughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this sewing machine as a gift for my 30+ yo granddaughter. She had been borrowing my daughter's sewing machine to make masks and now is wanting to start sewing. She is so excited over this machine and has started right away learning to "bond" with it. She gives it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! Small pieces like the foot that secures the presser foot never stay tight and the becomes loose and come apart and dislodges the needle. I’ve had other Brother sewing machines that was more efficient but this one can’t see one top with continuously having to change the needles or resecure the needle. Invest in a little more expensive machine!
customer_reviews.author: Ciari Green

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need it to do, and then some.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to see that it came with a needle threader. My 70+yo eyes are not what they used to be!. Imagine my chagrin when I figured out that I need to thread the darn bobbin! Watch the DVD first. The written instructions are somewhat hard to understand,especially if you are a beginner. I no longer sew much but when I need a machine I need it. This one will do way more than I will ever need and the price was right. Probably a good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has been great for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: My mom and I love this machine. I purchased it so we could sew masks together. I have no experience sewing and I picked it up quickly. It seems to work fine, and I have had no issues except that the thread holder could be a bit sturdier to hold the thread a bit more tighter. I couldn’t follow the directions but a quick YouTube video fixed that. The threader is a nice touch and helpful for my mom who struggles to see to thread the needle.
customer_reviews.author: cjczmommy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, very cute and light weight
customer_reviews.text: Very practice. I like it & not to heavy I have hand & arms issues & able to carry. I just don’t like the handle, it kinda opens up from the top when lifted And I feel that over the years it might break, maybe not but I rather not take a chance. It’s easy to use & perfect if stable in one place- very cute!
customer_reviews.author: Zobie

customer_reviews.title: My 8-year-old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My kids and I enjoy sewing and often they have it more than I. A great beginner project is rope projects with close line. No bits of fabric mess and project is quickly done. Also sewing on construction paper works great. Kids can refill and load bobbin easily which was an issue with our singer. We love this machine! Just not a fan of flower design but that’s minor.
customer_reviews.author: mandalinl

customer_reviews.title: Everything
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my wigs. I'm a beginner, so it was very simple for me to catch on. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: Tee

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners, great machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 13 year old daughter I haven't even touched it and she completely learned how to use it with the how to video that comes with it, and is sewing on her own without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Stefany

customer_reviews.title: Don’t hesitate! Buy this machine!
customer_reviews.text: I could not be happier with this sewing machine! I bought this during the pandemic when I decided to make masks and sell them. There weren’t many options available but when I came across this one I knew Brother was a good brand, so I took a chance and ordered it. It was worth every penny! And then some! Easy to use if you are a beginner or just getting back into sewing. It doesn’t take up much room and is light and easy to move around. I am looking forward to making many more projects in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Carly M

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This it’s a great sewing machine. I have to say I did not know how to saw. I wanted to make some mask for friends and family. Well I’m very proud of myself. After watching some YouTube videos I made some mask and they came out pretty good. I keep learning and maybe when all this it’s over I will take a class even thought YouTube it’s very good on how to do videos. I recommend this sewing machine for beginners like me very simple and easy to used.
customer_reviews.author: Pelusatxz

customer_reviews.title: Tension would not adjust correctly
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't able to adjust the stitch tension correctly, despite trying various settings and fabrics, so I returned it. I'm not an expert by any means, but I have sewed from time to time for over 30 years and wasn't impressed by this machine. I bought it to replace a Huskystar that will no longer sew in reverse, because I thought the cost to repair it would be more than what I paid for this machine. However, compared to the Huskystar, the Brother machine is very loud and just seems like an inferior machine.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Sewing Machine
customer_reviews.text: I needed a portable sewing machine to take to classes and this is perfect. Sews smoothly and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy W

customer_reviews.title: Great value easy to use sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use sewing machine. I've always bought Singer brand before but I've noticed some of the reviews have been rather lackluster. Instructions were great since just a little different than the Singer to thread plus my Singer was 30 years old. Had to buy new bobbins since my Singer brand wouldn't fit. This inexpensive machine sews smoothly like a dream. Comes with a DVD as well and very clear instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love!
customer_reviews.text: Last summer had oldest granddaughter. Her mother sent her sewing machine so I could teach granddaughter to sew. It was this machine. I have not sewed in 40 years or more so I was nervous. This machine was so easy to set up and use without any hassles. I am now sewing my tops costing me less money rather than buying the cheap tops from china. I use better quality material and can make a top that fits me perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Mamacita

customer_reviews.title: Great machine and good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This was my first sewing machine and I feel so confident using this! I really struggled with the video and instructions provided, but I had a friend come show me how to use it. It has been a gem since then! Once you get the hang of it, this is truly a great machine. It probably has a lot more features than you need as a beginner-- tons of stitches I don't even know how to use yet! But it's not complicated to use if you're using it as a first machine. Great to learn on and great to grow your skills! Also I feel it's a very sturdy machine, very quality. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Brother XM2701 Sewing Machine, Lightweight, Full Featured, 27 Stitches, 6 Included Feet
product_meta.description:
Style Name:XM2701

This Brother machine is perfect for multiple everyday sewing projects. Featuring a full range of user-friendly features and a lightweight design, the Brother XM2701 is perfect for beginners who are learning to sew and more advanced sewers who are looking for versatility.

The Brother XM2701 sewing machine offers 27 built-in stitches including blind hem, decorative, and quilting stitches with an automatic one-step buttonholer for virtually perfect buttonholes. The XM2701 has been engineered for easy use, featuring 6 quick-change sewing feet, including buttonhole, zipper, zigzag, narrow hemmer, blind stitch, and button sewing feet. Users will enjoy the ease of sewing cuffs, sleeves, and pant legs with the built-in free arm.

Designed for a broad range of users, the XM2701 also comes with a built-in easy needle threader, a jam-resistant Quick-Set top drop-in bobbin, and an automatic bobbin winding system. This affordable Brother machine is backed by a 25-year limited warranty along with free customer phone and online technical support for the life of the product.
feature_bullets: 27 Unique built-in stitches: The XM2701 includes 27 built-in stitches including decorative, blind hem, zigzag, and stretch stitches and an auto-size buttonhole

Automatic needle threader and drop-in top bobbin: This sewing machine includes an automatic needle threader that perfectly pushes thread through the needle and a convenient, jam resistant drop-in top bobbin
Included accessories: The XM2701 comes with 6 sewing feet, 3-piece needle set, twin needle, 4 bobbins, instructional DVD, manual and more
Versatile free arm: This free arm sewing machine is perfect for a wide range of everyday sewing projects, and users from beginners to advanced
At your side support: The XM2701 sewing machine comes with Brother At your side support offering free technical support via online, live chat or phone for the life of your machine
